content.title: Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Art Exhibitions: Group Shows
content.details: The 'Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Art Exhibitions: Group Shows' was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage talented artists in the field of painting and sculpture by granting a sum of ₹50,000/- to groups of five artists for conducting 'Group Shows' art exhibitions. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu.
eligibility: The applicant should be a group of artists.
The artists should be natives of Tamil Nadu by continuous residence for not less than 5 years.
The artists should have continuous involvement in their field of painting and sculpture.
The artists should possess an adequate number of artworks for the conduct of their show.
Participation in National or State level Art Exhibitions and Artists Camps will be considered as an additional qualification.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should visit the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu (Tamil Nadu Fine Arts Academy) during office hours to request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. After filling in all mandatory fields and attaching required documents, submit the application form either directly or by post to the Member Secretary, Tamil Nadu Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu, Directorate of Art and Culture, Dr. D.G.S. Dinakaran Road, (Greenways Road) Chennai - 600 028.
documents_required: Photographs of Artworks of the Artists.
Copies of Press Cuttings (if any) published in Newspapers/Journals on their Artistic Talents.

faqs.question: What is the primary focus of the Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Art Exhibitions?
faqs.answer: The primary focus is to support and promote talented artists in the fields of painting and sculpture through group shows art exhibitions.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for granting financial assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu, is responsible for granting the financial assistance.

faqs.question: What is the significance of participating in National or State level Art Exhibitions and Artists Camps?
faqs.answer: Participation in such events is considered as an additional qualification for eligibility under this scheme.

faqs.question: How are the applications for this scheme accepted?
faqs.answer: The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed format available at the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu during office hours.

faqs.question: Can artists from outside Tamil Nadu apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only artists who are natives of Tamil Nadu by continuous residence for at least 5 years are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: How long should artists be residents of Tamil Nadu to be eligible?
faqs.answer: Artists should be residents of Tamil Nadu for a continuous period of not less than 5 years to meet the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Where is the Directorate of Art and Culture located for submitting the application form?
faqs.answer: The Directorate of Art and Culture is located at Dr. D.G.S. Dinakaran Road, (Greenways Road) Chennai - 600 028.

faqs.question: What documents are required to be submitted along with the application form?
faqs.answer: The required documents include the bio-data of the artists, passport-sized photographs of the artists, photographs of artworks, and copies of press cuttings (if any) showcasing their artistic talents.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A sum of ₹50,000/- is granted to the groups of five artists for conducting art exhibitions.

faqs.question: Can individual artists apply for this scheme, or is it strictly for groups?
faqs.answer: The scheme is specifically for groups of artists, and individual applications will not be accepted.
